title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists forecast heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding for southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island from Sunday night to Monday.
National Weather Service indicates a 'high impact' nor'easter with the potential to disrupt power and cause significant snowfall in metro Boston.
The storm could follow a Track 1 path, leading to severe weather conditions, including possible blizzard conditions in Cape Cod and the Islands.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman declined to comment on Boston Red Sox president Sam Kennedy's statements about his departure from the team.
Sam Kennedy implied that Bregman left due to opting not to stay with the Red Sox, despite interest from both parties.
Bregman signed with the Chicago Cubs, emphasizing a no-trade clause in his contract, but stressed other factors in his decision.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now' (Redux) featuring Robert Duvall available on Pluto TV and Plex, commemorates the late actor's legacy.
'Blue Moon' (2025), a Richard Linklater film starring Ethan Hawke as Lorenz Hart, now streaming on Netflix.
'The Last Thing He Told Me' Season 2 with Jennifer Garner streams on Apple TV, adapting Laura Dave's sequel novel.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora says Marcelo Mayer must improve offensively to secure an Opening Day roster spot.
Mayer batted .228 with four home runs and 28 RBI in 44 games last season, but his defense was strong.
Mayer, not participating in the World Baseball Classic, can focus on spring training and prove his health and skill.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists predict a nor'easter will impact southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island Sunday night through Monday.
Heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding are expected, with up to a foot of snow in some areas.
Power outages are possible due to heavy, wet snow and high winds, particularly on the South Shore and Cape Cod.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in court for the first time since allegedly killing her three children in January 2023.
The court discussed logistics for Clancy's July 20 murder trial, including expert evaluations and pending motions.
Clancy's defense argues she suffered from postpartum mental illness; she plans to pursue an insanity defense.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly voted 10-5 to advance a home rule petition for a real estate transfer fee on sales over $1 million.
The fee, pending state approval, could raise up to $60 million annually for housing and range from 0.5% to 4%.
Revenue would predominantly aid towns' housing initiatives, and legislative support includes State Senators Cyr and Fernandes.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police are on alert for a planned 'Northshore Mall takeover' set for 3 p.m. Friday at the mall.
Authorities are linking the event to similar vehicle takeovers involving car burnouts and drag racing in other Massachusetts cities.
Governor Maura Healey condemned these events and allocated a $14 million grant for prevention and safety efforts.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven members of the Harvard Street Gang face federal drug and firearms charges after a multi-city investigation in Massachusetts.
Authorities seized 25 firearms, drugs, and tens of thousands in cash from locations in Brockton, Randolph, and Eastern Massachusetts.
The gang has been under investigation since 2019, linked to drug trafficking, firearms offenses, and violent criminal activities.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Celtics for the Warriors, citing reasons beyond basketball for his decision.
Horford spent a total of seven seasons with the Celtics, winning an NBA title with the team.
Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla praised Horford, calling him a Hall-of-Famer and valuing their coaching relationship.
